page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY 3
page.content: {Orall tradition:}In the 1920s one stock man at Marshside walked his bull on a lead like a dog to give it exercise, a custom not much less amazing is that of a modern resident of Maypole who takes a small elephant for walks. The {Home Guard}in World War 2 guarded a local Water Works and later in the war the big RAF Ammuniton Dump at Trenly Park. In the Second World War soldiers used to practice around the village of Marshside. The { {Battle of Britian}was fought over the area and the villagers watched the "con trails" of fighters and bomber cross and recross. Later Doodle Bugs flew overhead and a{bomber}crashed at Chislet. Also a butcher was killed by an emeny plane firing at the village. There were four local men who went to the war and never came back.
